poem:
### A New Era Unfurled

A crackle of tariffs across the sea,  
threads of rhetoric, bold, unspun—  
not just weights upon trade's tender scales  
but an epoch's unblinking dawn.  
Keir, with cautious gaze,  
sees the loom,  
sees the patterns change;  
not merely tactics,  
but the wind's shift,  
the fabric's new weave  
in this story of tides.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "UK politics: Starmer warns Trump’s US tariffs not just ‘short-term tactical exercise’ – as it happened 6.00pm BST Early evening summary Keir Starmer has said that the Trump tariffs are the start of a “new era”, and not just “a short-term tactical exercise”. (See 3.52pm.) He was speaking at Labour’s local elections campaign launch as Jonathan Reynolds, the business secretary, was in the Commons updating MPs on the government’s formal response to Trump’s plan. Reynolds". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.

(See 3.52pm.) He was speaking at Labour’s local elections campaign launch as Jonathan Reynolds, the business secretary, was in the Commons updating MPs on the government’s formal response to Trump’s plan.
